name: Elven Jesters
background:
The Elven Jesters are extravagantly dressed warrior-entertainers who serve anyone willing to employ them. They are clad in light armor which allows them to move swiftly over the battlefield to deal deft blows with close range weapons, while relying on their employers to account for their weaknesses.

As the Elves who survived the Robot uprising banded together into high fleets and dark gangs, some Elves fit into neither. These Elves adapted by breaking off into their own bands, and became mercenaries and entertainers, travelling from place to place before their hosts could tire of them, living as perpetual outcasts.
backgroundFull:
The Elven Empire was once a dominant power within the Sirius Sector, possessing both advanced psychic abilities and highly advanced technology, but when their servant Robots gained sentience, a conflict broke out and the Elves were forced to evacuate their home worlds. However, not all Elves who escaped this conflict were High Elven Nobles or members of the gangs who would form the Dark Elves. Some Elves were away from the Elven worlds when the conflict broke out or managed to escape through some other means, and sought out refuge with neighbouring factions.

These survivors soon came together to build small communities. These communities often existed on the edge of their new worlds, as many feared that they might attract the wrath of the Robot Legions, or that they were secretly in league with the Dark Elven Raiders. These Elven communities worked hard to prove their worth to their adopted homes to gain acceptance as guests, rather than be viewed as pariahs or vagrants. They soon became known as capable artists, mechanics, entertainers and warriors in equal measure. These Elves constantly strove to make themselves indispensable and valuable to their hosts, at least long enough to find their next home.

Slowly, these communities reached out to their kin among the High Elf Fleets and then the Dark Elves. Yet, many Elves did not find themselves at home amongst either of them. Just as they had with other hosts, they kept their distance and provided their services at a fair rate. Some found a permanent home amongst these Elven factions, but most eventually moved on, just as they had with other factions. The Elves who continued to move on became known as the Elven Jesters, as they often presented themselves primarily as entertainers, rather than mercenaries or traders.

These Jester bands have been on the move throughout the Sirius Sector ever since their home worlds were lost. They believe that to remain too long in one place would allow them to get comfortable and dull their abilities, until eventually they could no longer be of use. Instead, they are constantly seeking out new knowledge, skills and stories to build on their own, and this variety of skills makes their services greatly sought after by a number of other factions.

How will you find your way in the Sirius Sector?

spells.name: Asphyxiating Fog
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Counter-Attack once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Blades of Discord
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 1 hit with AP(2) and Deadly(3).

spells.name: Shadow Dance
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Rapid Blink Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Light Fragments
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 4 hit with AP(1) and Fragment.

spells.name: Veil of Madness
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets Slayer against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (this._skirmish ? 1 : this.AuraSize), avgUnit: true }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Fatal Sorrow
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which takes 6 hit.

specialRules.name: Rapid Blink
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within 3" of their position.

specialRules.name: Point-Blank Surge
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies within 12", unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Takedown Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, when it's this model's turn to attack in melee, you may pick one model in the unit as its target, and make one attack at Quality 2+ with AP(2) and Deadly(3), which is resolved as if it's a unit of 1.

specialRules.name: Evasive
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Shred when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Shred when shooting.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unpredictable Fighter.

specialRules.name: Teleport Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Teleport.

specialRules.name: Shielded Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Shielded.

specialRules.name: Slayer Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which friendly units gets Slayer against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Ambush Re-Deployment
specialRules.description: Once per game, when a unit where all models have this rule ends its activation, you may immediately remove it from the table (dropping any objectives it might hold within 1"), and deploy it as if it had Ambush at the beginning of the next round.

specialRules.name: Fragment
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and against units where most models have Defense 2+ to Defense 4+, this weapon gets AP(+1).

specialRules.name: Rapid Blink Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Rapid Blink Boost.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds dont carry over to other models if the original target is killed.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Teleport
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, place this model anywhere fully within 6" of its position.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9 away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush cant seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Rapid Blink Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Rapid Blink, it may be placed within 6" from Rapid Blink (instead of only within 3").

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack
specialRules.description: Strikes first when charged.
